etymology.description: 運(運) (yùn, "transport; move") and 動(動) (dòng, "move; act") together convey the concept of movement or activity. The combination suggests engaging in physical activity or movement, which can be interpreted as exercise or sports.
etymology.interpretation: The word 运动(運動) (yùndòng) refers to engaging in physical activities or sports, emphasizing the idea of movement and action.

examples.chinese: 我每天运动(我每天運動)。
运动使身体更强壮(運動使身體更強壯)，也带来快乐(也帶來快樂)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòng shǐ shēntǐ gèng qiángzhuàng, yě dàilái kuàilè.
examples.english: Exercise makes the body stronger and brings joy.

examples.chinese: 参加运动会可以结识朋友(參加運動會可以結識朋友)，体验团队精神(體驗團隊精神)。
examples.pinyin: Cānjiā yùndònghuì kěyǐ jiéshí péngyǒu, tǐyàn tuánduì jīngshén.
examples.english: Participating in a sports meet can help you make friends and experience team spirit.
